Posts.Content: Hello,  I know you have had this post for awhile and I am hoping your mom is holding her own.  My mom had stage iv bc and passed last year.  During her last month or so, she could hardly walk and wasn't really eating anything, just like your mom.  However, shortly before she passed she seemed to try and walk and ate a bit.  But thereafter it went downhill.  I know you are a nurse, so it seems you will be more prepared than I was.  I feel for you.  It is simply devastating.  I can tell you that my mom was without pain and in deep sleep when she passed.  At the moment of her passing, she opened her eyes for the first time in a week, looked clearly where the wall meets the ceiling and mouthed the word "Mama" over and over again (her mom had passed many years previously).  Such was her last gift to me, to allow me to see that she was in good hands and would be alright.  Peace to you and your mom during this painful journey.
Posts.Title: mum had primary breast cancer now terminal with brain mets

Posts.Content: Hello, My name is Mary.  My mother also has stage IV breast cancer to her liver.  She started out with a mastectomy 5 years ago, followed by chemo and arimidex.  Yesterday, we had a consultation with her dr. who suggests Faslodex to contain the cancer.  Perhaps also a light chemo to start with, but you can't do both chemo and Faslodex at the same time.  Her dr. did say she can live many years.  They have 16 drugs in their breast cancer arsenel to attack these tumors.  So please know that there is much hope for a fulfilling life.  I am so glad your mom got into MD Anderson - a premier cancer center!  You are doing all of the right things, but remember to take care of yourself.  You are grieving the loss of her health, and that is normal.  But way too early - maybe many many years - to grieve her loss.  Blessings to you all. Mary
Posts.Title: Mom was just diagnosed with Stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Oh Dolly, I was so glad to read your post!  My mom was just diagnosed with stage iv in the liver 5 years after mastectomy, chemo and arimidex.  She will be treated with Faslodex.  Do you know anything about this?  Can you talk about your regimen?  I agree, from what all of the drs. are telling us, she can live many many years.  Sounds like you have a wonderful family.  This blog is just inspiring and so are you.  Mary

Posts.Title: Mom was just diagnosed with Stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hello,  My mom has kjust been diagnosed bc to liver.  She was 5 years after mastectomy, chemo (8 rounds) and arimidex.  We just came from the dr.  Her suggestion is monthly injections of Faslodex followed by scans in a few months.  I agree that it does seem like a long time to wait.  Have you heard of anyone getting chemo first to shrink it and then the Faslodex?  Dr. says some physicians go this route.  I am going to Sloan Kettering next week for a consult and will be glad to let you know.  Stay strong and blessings to you all.
